comment: This was the worst professor I've had at KSU. The role plays are completely unrealistic and teach nothing about real sales. He's conceded, rude, and constantly talks down to students. Grading is harsh and inconsistent, and his feedback is so vague you'll never know why you lost points. The class feels like a complete waste of time. Horrible person.

This dude expects you to become a professional seller by the end of the semester. I was always at class even when he would no show for his back surgery and not say anything. One of the hardest graders I have experienced and if you want some extra credit, you have to go pay to watch his son's grueling comedy show in Alpharetta.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I cannot stress this enough. Had I known he is the only professor who teaches Adv. Selling (required for sales degrees), I WOULD NOT HAVE TAKEN THIS DEGREE. He is that awful. Required attendance with business attire, unhelpful lectures, ludicrously strict grading, and shadowing real salespeople projects make him and this degree impossible to rec.

comment: Very passionate about prof. selling, he grades very hard. This was the most stressful class I had all semester. So much pressure is built around RP assignments. Quizzes are 40 questions long. Lots of packbacks. Required networking events. Textbook is required for everything. Dedicate a lot of time to this class in order to pass.

comment:
"Dr". Loe offers low quality, high condescending teaching. His class is largely graded on role-plays, which are not accurate to the real world in any way. His lectures, are so off topic, and uses filler words that when it comes to grading, he will fail you for speaking the same way. 

Do not take this teacher, do not attempt to take this teacher,

Ppoint lectures provide 99% of the class info. 6+ recorded zoom meetings for role-playing< - very time-consuming. Quiz every week 30-45 questions each quiz. Lockdown but no video. Do good with roleplay assignments- account for 45% of your grade.

Professor Loe is actually a great professor/mentor! Purchase the books once you see the syllabus they are required for the quizzes. Practice your role plays and understand each component of the sales process used. Theres extra credit if you participate in the competitions and events. Definitely a class I was skeptical about but I learned so much.

Dr. Loe is a great professor if you are interested in learning more about a sales career. He is NOT an easy professor, and you will feel very overwhelmed throughout the semester. However, if you work hard, he will respect you for that. Ive learned more from his class than any of my other classes.

To find his first Rate my professor, look up: T loe. Terry Loe makes you do his job as you recruit companies for an event he hosts. He is a conceded man and talks down to students & thinks that he is the absolute best at everything. Very disappointing that Kennesaw has only this outdated professor teaching the capstone sales class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He cares a lot about this material; this makes him a little crazy about every detail. Quizes are tough, but there are no tests. The role plays are intense; you must go by his rubric EXACTLY. He will count off for everything (even things you do correctly he wont give full credit). He can be a little sassy and very passionate: does not tolerate fools

Dr. Loe is a tough grader, but if you pay attention to the notes he gives you and make corrections based on that, you will do fine in this course! Selling isn't for everybody, but he gives clear criteria as far as what's expected from you. You won't get an A handed to you, but he will recognize hard work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: This was by far the worst professor I have taken at this university, DO NOT TAKE HIM. If you want unclear instructions, terrible feedback, and a generally rude professor this is for you. He makes everything terribly difficult and then won't explain why you did bad and his reason for that is because you did bad and should look at more material.

comment: Dr. Loe is a great professor. IT ISN'T EASY. However, if you are willing, this class is all about applying yourself. If you do and put the work in you will grow &develop skills you didn't have. Weekly quizzes/assignments, role plays, out of class sales assignment, and a paper. Be enthusiastic to learn, complete the assignments and you will do fine!
